subject: Re: [junit] Test isolation and class-level data
msgSnippet: ... If possible, convert from the Singleton pattern (the static variable) to use Dependency Injection to pass the Singleton object into the object under test.
messageBody:
On 5/31/05, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains@...> wrote:
> azuroff wrote:
> > That brings up an interesting question - can test methods in classes
> > that contain static variables really be considered isolated, since one
> > test can accidentally change the static value needed by another test?
> > And if you're going to reinitialize the static variable in the
> > setUp() method every time, then what's the point in the variable being
> > static?

If possible, convert from the Singleton pattern (the static variable)
to use Dependency Injection to pass the Singleton object into the
object under test. Performing this refactoring will make the object
easier to test.
